column4: hmm, shouldn't update-manager -d give me the option to upgrade to Edgy? (devel)
last update doesn't start your x server
Erm? I'm already in X
are you on edgy?
I really don't know why it said after the last update that X server cannot find the font: "fixed"
No, hence why I assumed that would update it TO Edgy (although I think I may be misunderstanding that)
Erm, I think you're confusing me with someone else
why?
why I confuse you?
erm, I never mentioned any fonts or anything
the easiest update: change in /etc/apt/sources.list the word: dapper with edgy. Then you should do sudo apt-get update and sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
thanks
anyway take care, and make a backup system to do that
the updates need to be polished a bit :)
Meh, I used Gentoo on this machine for 4 years, I'm used to things breaking all the time
whelcome to Ubuntu :)
if you want to compile some packages (as you do in Gentoo) you may do: apt-get source packagename
and in the current folder it will appear the source which you may compile any time
I know, heh, but if I compile from source I prefer to download from the programs site and do it manually
do you know how to setup the X server to work?
Yeah, why?
